msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Coordinated check-in of SDK and FXGUtils integration for the bitmap-related changes for FXG 2.0 compliancy. This includes several API changes documented below:
1. BitmapGraphic is now BitmapImage in FXG. All this requires is changing the mapping in fxg-manifest.xml
2. BitmapGraphic and BitmapFill's resizeMode property is renamed to fillMode
3. BitmapResizeMode const class is now named BitmapFillMode
4. BitmapFillMode's noScale enum is now called clip
5. Border's backgroundImageResizeMode style is now called backgroundImageFillMode
Doc notes: Yes - the API renames needs to be reflected in the documentation
Reviewer: Evtim for SDK, Corey for FXGUtils stuff
Tests run: FXG static and runtime
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Add URL support to BitmapFill and Border
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-23108 - backGroundImage referenced via URL results in runtime error
Add in support for URLs into BitmapFill and BorderSkin.
QE notes: Add tests for BitmapFill source set to a URL
Doc notes: Add notes about URL support
Is noteworthy for integration: Yes. Source can be URL.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-22932 - Border's backgroundAlpha style has no effect when backgroundImage is set

I have added an alpha property to BitmapFill. Since graphics.beginBitmapFill doesn’t have an alpha parameter, I have to clone the bitmapData source and apply to it a colorTransform (which contains the alphaMultipler).
If the source image doesn't support an alpha channel (ex. JPEG), then I need to copy the source into a new bitmapData object that supports transparency. This occurs one time in the source setter.

If the alpha or source has changed, then I need to copy the source into a new bitmapData. The reason is that using the BitmapData.colorTransform function is cumulative. Once I've applied an alphaMultiplier to it, there is no way to restore the alpha. I've optimized the code a bit to only copy the bitmapData if needed. For example, if we have already copied the data to add the transparent pixel border (to prevent the streaking effect on a non-repeating fill), then we forgo the copying.
QE notes: Need new tests for this property
Doc notes: Need docs for this property
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-22918 - When the Border component style borderVisible is set to false the top line of the Border is still visible
Don’t draw the inset drop shadow if borderVisible == false
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-22937 - Border's toolTip does not display via a mouseOver the content area
If we don’t have a backgroundFill, backgroundColor, or backgroundImage, then use a transparent fill to register mouse interactions
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-22925 - Border component has a default size of 2x2
Set the default width and height to 112, the same as for List
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-22953 - Border has strange shadow when cornerRadius and borderWeight are set
If the borderWeight is 10 or greater, then for the drop shadow just draw a straight line. Wider strokes have squared off inner corners.
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-22952 - Border only receives mouse events when they occur on the border
If we don’t have a backgroundFill, backgroundColor, or backgroundImage, then use a transparent fill to register mouse interactions
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-22926 - Border component has a default borderStyle of inset
Updated the Border type selector. The global selector already sets borderStyle = “inset” for the Halo components.
Doc notes: Added default dimensions of 112 x 112 for Border
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

I updated the logic for drawing the inset. First of all, if there is no cornerRadius, then we just draw a straight line. The other change is instead of drawing 1 quadratic curve, we now draw 2 quadratic curves per corner, using the algorithm from GraphicUtils.drawRoundRectComplex.
